snippet: Addiction, Rabbi Shais Taub argues, is less a chemical dependency or a mental illness than the consequence of an individual’s absence from God.
abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column highlights the work of Hasidic Rabbi Shais Taub, whose writings underscore the spiritual component in recovery from drug and alcohol addiction; notes Taub has found an eager audience among Christians and secular people alike.
lead_paragraph: Addiction, Rabbi Shais Taub argues, is less a chemical dependency or a mental illness than the consequence of an individual’s absence from God.

headline.print_headline: A Rabbi’s Teachings on Recovery Find an Unexpected Audience
